result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendrick L. MILLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to the prison sentence presently being served on 15 CF 261, to commence on defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.  
Court authorizes transfer of probation to the State of Iowa if DOC approves.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Information charges 3 cts. Felony Bail Jumping, contrary to Section 946.49(1)(b) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
Alan Tarnowski, through Public Defender.

Preliminary held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
Arraignment is set for 09-23-16 at 1:45 p.m.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-31-16 at 10:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-22-16 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $7,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition the defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail for failure to furnish cash bail ordered in 15 CF 261.
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
WARRANT FEES $400.00
Defendant was arrested in Cedar Co., Iowa.
RE:  Felony bail jumping, on 08/30/2015, on 08/30/2015
